Articles.Content: Put a minimum of 10,000 fuel units into Kerbin orbit, this equates to 20 regular tanks...
how can you carry 20x500 gallons of fuel into orbit ???

how can you carry 20x500 gallons of fuel into orbit ???

Very carefully. You can lift massive rockets if you do it right.

Very carefully. You can lift massive rockets if you do it right.

it\'s hard though, you\'d need a rocket with an engine with thrust of 5,000

Put a minimum of 10,000 fuel units into Kerbin orbit, this equates to 20 regular tanks...

Fairly straightforward:

This is actually far more fuel (and distributed far more strangely) than I was expecting. 0.15.2\'s fuel flow bugs are likely to blame. 24 full (500 fuel unit) tanks, 6 with 122.5527, 6 with 122.7127, for 13,471.5924 fuel units. No provision for fuel transfer or crew return was specified in the challenge. =P

In a less buggy version (0.14.x or 0.13.3?), I would have expected 10-12,000 fuel units in 19 full and 19 partial tanks.

edit:

it\'s hard though, you\'d need a rocket with an engine with thrust of 5,000

Maximum thrust with this ship is 3,775 8)
Not really hard if you\'re willing to use mods (NovaPunch 1.2 beta, MechJeb). Approximately 46000 kg of fuel reached orbit with this ship.
I forgot to mention that the fuel tanks can\'t have engines attached 8)

I forgot to mention that the fuel tanks can\'t have engines attached 8)

Please specify these things beforehand. >

Well, here\'s 21 tanks (10,500 fuel units) being dropped off in LKO:

I forgot to mention that the fuel tanks can\'t have engines attached 8)

I think if I where to put fuel depo into orbit, I would very much like some kind of engine to de-orbit the thing once I\'m done with it. I like to keep Kerbin clear of space debris... Heck even the ISS has an engine to adjust the orbit.

I think I\'ll wait till docking is fully implemented until I attempt a mission like this. Then I\'ll have to put a fuel depo in orbit, and then rondevu and dock with another craft. I also suggest putting a Ton of RCS fuel into orbit since that is what we\'ll use most for docking manoeuvres.

*edit* Done

With extra RCS on the side and enough fuel to de orbit the sucker too... In case of emergences of course...
